description: A short lesson to help you apply The AMOC and Its Possible Collapse.

hook.text: The Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation is weakening. Scientists are watching closely.

buildup.text: AMOC is the Atlantic portion of the conveyor belt â€” it drives the Gulf Stream and deep currents.

discovery.text: Freshwater from melting ice dilutes salty North Atlantic water, reducing its density and sinking.

twist.text: Some models suggest AMOC could collapse within decades â€” an abrupt climate shift.

climax.text: A collapsed AMOC would disrupt monsoons, shift storm tracks, and cool Europe by several degrees.

punchline.text: The Atlantic's circulation is weakening. There is no bypass surgery.

quiz.question: What could cause the AMOC to collapse?
options: Freshwater from melting ice reducing water density
Volcanic eruptions on the ocean floor
Increased wind speeds over the Atlantic
